The campaign may have not been a successful in terms of completion, but as we noted before, not all goals are meant to be met. We gained something far more valuable and precious during this period: YOU!

campaign.story:
Hi Kickstarter! My name is Rune, and I need your help to create the ultimate Trump-bashing game for iOS, Android, Mac, Windows & Apple Tv! 
In this game you will be taken on a journey across Trump Land. A world filled with politicians, cyborgs, mutants, hippies and other nasty creatures. You will try your best to escape while getting chased by the grabby hands of Donald and his accomplices!
I made a working demo for iOS, Android, Mac, Windows & Apple Tv. It is a dream for me to be able to make it into a full featured game, with lots of levels, characters, gameplay improvements and unlockable achievements.  
The fully funded complete version of the game will feature 15 levels, 10 playable characters, an army of enemies and PS4, Xbox and Nintendo Switch versions aswell as animated cutscenes! 
You will be breaking out imprisoned people by the mexican border, smashing up Steve Bannon Brain Bots, flying the pink skies on a “unicorn” in “The Dream of Donald” and fighting atomic mutants in “The Horrors of Trump Tower”. 
In "The Dream of Donald" you will play the unicorn fantasy of Donald and Kim Jung as they are flying the skies of Trump Land. Unfortunately they can't find a Unicorn, so they have to dress up a horse with wings and rockets to make it fly. You will dodge evil hippies and other disorderly creatures that tries to tear down your dream.
In "The Horrors of Trump Tower", you will get to experience the horrible consequenses of a US nuclear crisis. This will be one of the final levels, where as the ones that lead up to this one will tell the story of how it all went this badly. 
These 5 screenshots are from the working demo for iOS, Android, Mac, Windows & Apple TV. The full funded version of the game will have gameplay improvements and further features. 
         You can have everything from early access, influensing the game development to your own playable character or a place in the "sponsered by" spot appearing when people open the game. 
 BECOME A PRISONER!
 Send me a picture of you or your aunt and I will make it into one of the prisoners in the game.  
The character will be a helper of removing some of the obstacles and smashing Trump on the way. Your character will have a special weapon or ability to help the player along the way. This character will appear in multiple levels. 

BECOME AN ENEMY OF THE DONALD!
Send me a picture of you or your little sister and I will turn it into one of the rocket fuelled enemies of the Donald in the “Dream of Donald” level. The character will be one of the obstacles in the Donalds pink tinted unicorn fantasy, trying to shoot him down from the skies. 
BECOME A PLAYABLE CHARACTER!
Send me a picture of you or your favourite person in the world and tell me what kind of weapon you would prefer and you will have the exclusive spot as a playable character in this game. You will be the one running from the grabby hands of Trump and you will have the possibility to wreak havoc amongst him and his accomplices. 

BILLBOARD SPOT!
Show your or your companys resistance to the Trump regime. You will get a billboard spot in the background of one of the levels. It can be a commercial for your company or organisation, or it can be a love declaration for your Trump hating friend. You decide the content of the billboard.
OFFICIAL SPONSOR!
Your companys/organisations logo will appear when you open the game, and a Donald Trump Voice Actor will say “Sponsored by your organisations name”. Your organisations name will be in the top credits as well. 
   I hope you will support the game and help me making this game a reality!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I already made and released the first mini version of the game on iOS, Android, Mac, Windows & Apple TV. The project is made so it is easy to update with new levels and characters to port to these platforms.
The way into console versions can be a bit trickier as these platforms have a tighter control of which games that can be released there. Because this is a political satire I cant guarantee that it will be approved on all platforms, but with a massive kickstarter backup, I expect it to be.
I expect to finish the project in November 2018, but this can both be before or later depending on how many stretch goals that gets funded.
If you have any questions or inqueries don't hesitate to email me.
Kind Regards
Rune, Rudie Productions

campaign.story:
Fatal Flash is a Competitive, 2D Online Mutliplayer Brawler that features lightning-paced, movement-heavy combat, numerous Archetypes ('Champions') with hundreds of customization options, and varied game modes and objectives - all rendered in hand-drawn, steampunk-inspired pixel art.
Fatal Flash was first conceived from an oxymoronic love of both the chaotic action and split-second decision making of fighting/shooter games, as well as the slower, but creatively-charged and customization-heavy metagame present in CCGs/MOBAs. While there have certainly been excellent titles exploring the synergy of these two elements before, we at Single "A" Productions have always wanted just a little more, and that is why we've decided to bring Fatal Flash to life - to take the idea to its fullest limits and endeavor to create an unique and exciting experience for all.
Just a year ago, Fatal Flash was nothing more than an idea; with the irreplaceable help of so many talented creators and friends from around the world, we've transformed that idea into a near-alpha stage game, with many major systems already in place and ready for additional assets and polish. We are running this Kickstarter now, in the hopes of receiving enough funding to take the game into Early Access, as well as reach out to our community for valuable advice, direction, and feedback.
Playable Demo
We are happy to present a demo build of Fatal Flash we've been working on for you to experience first hand. The demo features 6 Archetypes (outfitted with some customization options), 2 Elimination-based modes (FFA and Team), and online compatibility, meaning you can play with anyone around the world!
Please click the image below for instructions on downloading the build (Mac, PC or Linux); we sincerely hope you'll have as much fun playing as we've had making the game.
  Kindly note that it can be difficult to find open games with strangers due to the demo not being widely distributed; as such, we highly encourage playing with friends if possible! Additionally, please join our Discord , where in addition to find others looking to play the game, you'll get up to date information about our soon-to-come weekly tournaments, open to all!
Quick Overview:
Supported Platforms (Non-Stretch): PC/Mac/Linux (Distributed via Steam, Humble, GOG, and more!)
Controller Support: Yes
Languages: English, Français, Italiano, Deutsch, Español, 한국어, 日本語, 简体中文
Number of Players: Online Multiplayer (6 total players for 3v3) 
Target Release Date: Early 2019
 What To Expect
A free-to-play, multiplayer brawler with multiple game modes, to be played across a large pool of maps and modes
Beautiful hand-crafted pixel art, inspired by a darker, more fantastical steampunk aesthetic
10+ unique Archetypes at Early Access launch, each with a distinct play-style to suit all types of players. Archetypes can be further tweaked to your preference through hundreds of different Traits that alter skills and gameplay
Consistent support with free updates featuring new content (archetypes, traits, skins, maps, modes), and recurring seasonal/story events which provide special challenges and rewards
A community-focused development philosophy that not only prioritizes player feedback, but also promotes events and systems that allow players to have direct, visible impact on gameplay and lore
The World of Fatal Flash
Follow us!  
If you wish to keep up to date with the development of the game, or just want to see some more content, please refer to the below links!  
Twitter  Facebook  Website  Discord  Youtube  Instagram
The World:
The Continent of Ziakhvalle has always been on the brink of all-out war. The most powerful nation, Akrea, have long set their eyes on foreign territory and resources, and would have invaded long ago if not for the alliance known as the Union Against Belligerent Interests (UABI), which unites many sovereign states together in agreement to collectively fight Akrea, should they ever break the peace.
The Starless Nights
This stalemate which had long obstructed the break out of war collapsed when one day, a catastrophic meteor shower, now known as The Starless Nights, rained destruction upon Ziakhvalle. Millions of lives came to an abrupt end, while the entire continent was engulfed in complete darkness. Nearly a year later, when light finally returned to the land, a mysterious, sky-blue element was discovered within the meteorites in copious amounts.
Akrim Researchers study Azurium for the first time
The element would come to be known as Azurium. Preliminary experimentation revealed its incredible re-combinatory potential, and it wasn’t long before Akrea was able to weaponize the element, and arm soldiers in mass with the ability to instantly teleport great distances. Without a moment wasted, Akrea began their full scale invasion, eliminating many factions before they were able to muster any meaningful resistance. With options waning, the UABI had no choice but to research Azurium themselves, developing their own technologies in an attempt to combat the impending Akrean legions.
The Council Convenes
As tensions between Akrea and the UABI continued to escalate, reports began to spread about sightings of “shadowy beings” surfacing all across Ziakhvalle. The exact origin and purpose of these creatures are the subject of much speculation, but what is undeniable is their overwhelming numbers, unholy strength, and seemingly insatiable desire for death and destruction.
With unending chaos and carnage all but inevitable, only those able to grasp the mysteries of Azurium will have a chance to emerge from the darkness to come.
The Archetypes:
In Fatal Flash, you do not control heroes or legends. Instead, each Archetype is simply a template - a canvas with broadly defined strokes waiting for players to fill in the rest. From changing an Archetype's appearance and name, to replacing their skills and in extreme cases entirely changing play-styles, players will be granted full reign over the creation of their own unique Archetype, with whom they can go on to create their own legends and achievements.
Here is the current roster:
...and many more to come!
Each Archetype starts with 6 skills by default, and will always have access to 4 universal skills - basic attack, block, movement, and ultimate (though there exists noticeable nuances from Archetype to Archetype). The remaining two skills embody a unique mechanic specific to that Archetype, and help set it apart from the others.
Akrean Piercer Skills
All skills function on a cooldown system, with the exception of the ultimate, which is charged over time, as well as through dealing damage.
Akrean Piercer Ultimate
Players choose an archetype and are placed into teams of up to 3 players, whereupon they must work together to complete the various objectives (ranging from delivering a payload to classic deathmatch) provided by the chosen game mode.
Concepts of different Archetypes
In addition to fending off opposing Archetypes and completing objectives, players will discover several environmental elements that can both help and hinder their efforts.
Healing Stations (Large & Small)
For example, Healing Stations generate essential health recovery which can easily turn the tide of a battle.
Flame Traps
Flame Traps can be activated to grant your opponents (or allies) a swift, brutal death, or be used tactically to deny valuable space.
Crawling tentacles of doom (Force Field)
Last but not least, when a round timer depletes, the game enters Sudden Death, and a damaging force field begins moving in, shrinking the play space and forcing player confrontation.
Game Modes
With base funding, we can focus on perfecting the two core modes of the game. The first is Classic Elimination (FFA and Team), in which the primary aim is to claim as many lives as possible in a given time frame.
You just got ELIMINATED!
The second is the objective-based Core Collection mode, in which two teams must gather and deliver precious Azurium Cores to their base, whist preventing opponents from doing the same. When carried, Cores will drastically reduce mobility and skill-usage, but simultaneously increase Archetype lethality.
Core Collection Concept
There will be minimum of 2 distinct maps released for each mode, and with more support from the community, we would look into the creation of further interesting modes:
More Objective-Based Modes (Payload, Capture Points)
PvE Boss Raid with players banding together to take down terrifying, AI controlled bosses
Teleport Racing where players utilize their skills to either disrupt or get ahead of opponents, and be the first to reach the end!
Work in Progress In-Game Map
Visual Customization
The primary visual customization comes in the form of Archetype skins; each skin will be separated into three distinct body parts. For example, the S.H.I.E.L.D is split into Arm - Head & Torso - Legs. Each part is interchangeable, so you can combine and graft different parts from different skins however you like! Skins are purely cosmetic in nature, with no impact on core gameplay.
  Combine parts freely to create unique looks
 Further options, depending on the progression of various Stretch & Community Goals, are also available.

Taunts and Emotes:

Player Badges and Titles:
  Announcer Packs:
  Trait Customization
We understand that a large appeal of the "Class-Based" genre comes  from player attachment towards one or more characters. As such, each Archetype is designed with a unique style in mind, to help separate them from the others and appeal to different players. As examples, the Nightmare utilizes knockbacks and roots to crowd control and bully opponents, the Astralmancer relies on map-spanning range to eliminate opposition from afar, and the Akrean Piercer is reflexes personified - relying solely on speed and precision to gain value.
Loadout Menu Navigation
However, we also realize that there are simply too many players out there, and that it is not realistic to try and satisfy everyone with singular Archetype designs alone. That is why we have created the Traits System, a card-based modification platform that allows you to do anything from simply tweaking the stats of an Archetype, to changing the way a skill functions (or just flat out replacing it). With a maximum of three slots per loadout, and tens of hundreds of Traits at your disposal, you are given free reign to experiment and to create your own unique Archetypes and strategies.
Take for example, The Akrean Sky-Splitter's "Split Arrow" skill, which by default fires one large projectile that can split into 5 smaller projectiles.
The regular "Split Arrow" fires 5 projectiles
"That's not enough arrows for me" - you might think.  Well, add the "Blot Out The Sun" Trait, and you now have 10 split arrows on contact.
With 'Blot Out The Sun', it fires 10 Projectiles
Still not enough arrows? Throw on the "Fully Loaded" Trait to have two simultaneous charges of Split Arrow, for 20 total split arrows.
"Fully Loaded" now grants an effective 20 projectiles to your skill
But you're actually more of a healer main? Fine, use the "Scatter Heal" Trait, and now watch these 20 mini-arrows heal allies instead!
"Scatter Heal" Lets you heal allies instead!
  From the beginning of development, we have always envisioned Fatal Flash as a Free To Play title. We believe that a multiplayer game lives and dies by it’s player base, so for this reason, as well as the fact that Fatal Flash is our first large project, we wanted to provide an environment where all players can give the game a try, without being turned away by a price tag.
However, with Free To Play inevitably comes the issue of monetization, and we understand there will be worries of randomization and loot drops given our focus on customization and player choice. However, we want to assure you we have no plans to utilize a random rewards system, and will commit to a pay-upfront model, similar to that of Awesomenauts or Warframe. What this means is, all purchasable items, be it Traits or Cosmetic, will be directly unlocked through a one-time purchase.
Additionally, all Traits will be unlockable simply through playing the game and earning Azurite Shards - the only currency present in Fatal Flash. Most Cosmetic items can also be unlocked through Shards, with the exception of newly released items (which will be purchase-only for a limited period before becoming unlockable), and a few legendary cosmetic items (to maintain exclusivity for those who do choose to support the longevity of the game).
Even though we have a plan in place, and believe it is the right direction for the game, we realize that when it comes down to it, not everything may go as smoothly as we hope. As such, we are expecting, and very eager to work with our community throughout the full development cycle of the game - to ensure that the final game is one that will make you feel rewarded for your progress, but also one that can thrive and grow off its community.

Dear Backers,
It’s with a heavy heart that we announce today the cancellation of the Kickstarter for Fatal Flash.
It was a very tough decision for us to make, but after several internal meetings, and after getting feedback and interacting with many of you, we’ve come to the conclusion that the project needed a larger undertaking than we initially anticipated. We felt that even if we were fully funded, we would not be able to deliver all that we promised in time, and we did not want to release a subpar game which would diminish the overall experience.

Lighthaven Website
Dominus, the birthplace and home to mankind. Once a vast paradise, the land is now a broken and barren hellscape. Ash rains from the sky and the smell of death is inescapable. An unholy army pours fourth from the Abyss, loosed by mankind's constant sin and rebellion against the heavens. Angels watch on as the purge continues. Some come to witness the destruction first-hand... while others have come searching for heroes and to bring us hope.
Lighthaven stands as the last refuge and sanctuary for mankind. The city was founded by the three Archangels known as the Triune.  From their council chambers they lead, mentor, and inspire the last of us.  The Triune also bears watch on the gate to the Abyss, stopping the flow of demons into our world. Only heroes who have passed many trials and ascended are permitted to pass beyond the gate.
The Abyss stands as both gateway and throne to Astaroth.  From here, the demonic invasion pours forth into this world.  With the entirety of the planet ravaged, Astaroth has his sights set on Lighthaven.
Lighthaven is the only obstacle standing in the way of our annihilation and extinction. It is the place where this conflict began years ago, and this is the place it shall end.
  Dominus Concept
  Lighthaven is a Tactical Action Role Playing Game with Roguelike elements inserted for end-game progression and replayability. It features responsive movement and a 3rd-person-overhead camera. The controls use W-A-S-D + "Mouse Look" for movement with 8 abilities. Your 6 main abilities are your combat attacks. They change based on weapon type, and become enhanced with a higher tier weapon. Your other 2 abilities are for utility skills based on your class, which can become enhanced with modifiers from gear.
Pre-Alpha Actionbar
The main concept for Lighthaven is to bring back the atmospheric horror that early ARPGs brought to the table and take elements from other genres to create synergy with the gameplay. To do this, the development of Lighthaven is focusing two simple things:
Combat is being kept simple to force the focus on the atmosphere, uncertainty, and horror of the scene. The feeling of being mortal and that death is an almost certainty is meant to be kept present with each step.
A player will once again rely on their light radius for visual safety and comfort. This places the center of attention on the life.... and death, of the character.
The focus of Lighthaven's gameplay is going to be on its atmosphere and positional tactics in combat. There will be little slaying of zombie-like monster hordes and you will encounter small groups of stronger, more intelligent, and purposeful enemies.
Combat will be very basic and is based on an extremely simple builder/spender resource relationship. Abilities will be target-able, but also have basic hit boxes for aim-based action combat. Controls will be WASD with Forward/StrafeL/StrafeR/Backpedal using animation blend trees. and combat will be ability based using 8+ hotkeys.   The simple layout will allow players to also use a controller.
Lighthaven is written in C# on the Unity Engine. Saving is serialized with XML data-basing. The animation system and UI are both in the process of being overhauled to utilize new systems within Unity.
Lighthaven is intended to be launched as a single-player story-driven action rpg. The plans are to add multiplayer, and more classes... but these will be dependent on funding and time.
1st iteration of combat and UI
  New combat animations for Alpha with new UI elements
  Original games in the Action RPG genre were heavily influenced by Roguelikes and so is Lighthaven. Outside of the main story-arc, the main focus and development of Lighthaven will be placed on the end-game dungeon, the Abyss. The Abyss will feature randomized level progression.  The randomization is where Lighthaven will get some of it's Roguelike similarities, the other will be in partial perma-death. Lighthaven will feature points/camps throughout the world where you may export a small percentage of your stats once you have raised them by a certain threshold since your last save.
Lighthaven's progression system will be unique in that it will be level-less. This is because of the game's Roguelike nature. The idea is to be able to come back after a death on a new character with a portion of the power you had before your character dying. Because the final dungeon is designed to scale linearly, you will need all the help you can get to master the final levels and encounters.  The Abyss is planned to consist of 10 massive descending levels at the game's launch.
Raise your primary stats to unlock tiers of traits.
Traits will be locked once chosen upon, each new life.
To unlock traits on a fresh character you will need to have raised your stats past a certain threshold. At this point meditation at a shrine will save (serialize) a fraction of your primary stats.
A new character will have access to any traits they meet the stat requirement to unlock the trait's parent tier.
The 2 primary stats are Strength and Vitality. The higher your strength, the higher some offensive bonuses become and you will be granted access to higher tiers of offensive talents. The higher your vitality, the same is true for defensive stats and talents.
All loot is lost upon death.
However, killing a boss will not only have a chance of dropping a Legendary quality item, but will always drop a Demon Essence.
Demon Essence can be used to either bind a Legendary to your character to be summoned again later or to summon a legendary you have already bound.
Once bound, a Legendary can be summoned infinitely. 1 Demon Essence will be required per bind or summon.
Explore.  Gain stats. Unlock traits. Bind Legendary artifacts, weapons, and armor.  Hope to see the end...
Pre-Alpha Weaponry
  Pre-Alpha inventory panel
    Lighthaven's game world will consist of connected zones with dungeons located in areas beyond the gates of Lighthaven.
Explorable Zones of Dominus
The city of Lighthaven which lies to the West of the Abyss.
Explorable zones to the North, South, and East of the Abyss.
The Gate to the Abyss.
The Abyss... a dungeon that scales is scope and difficulty the further you delve.
The city of Lighthaven will act as a hub for the player to interact with NPC's, arm themselves with gear, and prepare for the adventures beyond the gates.
The 3 surrounding zones will serve to give the player places to explore the world and the lore of Dominus.  The quests and lore will lead the player to the gates of the Abyss should they survive.  What lies beyond, only the strong will discover.

  NPC Lodging within the City of Lighthaven

Game Key:  Lighthaven will be distributed digitally over the Steam network.  Lighthaven will sell for $20.00 USD upon release scheduled in late 2018 to early 2019.
Founder's T-Shirt:  For those who are extremely excited about the development of Lighthaven and would like to contribute a little more.  Help spread the word with this limited Founder T-Shirt!
Hardcover Art Book:  These books are being printed on hardback in limited supply.  The book will feature over 30 prints of Lighthaven's concept art in addition to a brief developer diary from development.
Immortal Hero:  Immortalize your name within the game of Lighthaven.  A legendary artifact, weapon, or armor will be named after you.  In addition, you will also have your name written on a hero's grave within the crypts of the city of Lighthaven for all to see.
Limited Founder's T-Shirt
Rewards
$14,850:  The initial funding that is currently needed to finish Lighthaven on-schedule.
$22,350:  If funding reaches this point; a new main attribute, Dexterity with a new set of traits, will be added along with the Rogue base-class. 
$29,850:  If funding reaches this point; another main attribute, Intelligence with another set of traits, will be added along with the Mage base-class.
$41,550:  If funding reaches this point; the Abyss will be expanded from 10 levels to 100 with 10x the number of unique enemies, tile-sets, bosses, and loot.  In addition, 1 more explorable zone will be added within the bowels of the Abyss.
Lighthaven is planned to release at the end of the 4th Quarter 2018 to the early 1st Quarter 2019 on Steam.

campaign.story:
Arkon is a fast paced strategy card game, played from one central deck of 52 cards. Players must win clans, either through an interactive bidding process that functions like a silent auction or through using their cards as actions, to take other players clans. Arkon's depth and replay-ability are tied to having cards that can be played in many ways and its use of interpersonal interactions (bidding, bluffing etc.).
# of players: 2-4
Average game duration: 15-30 minutes
Arkon hinges around a few central dynamics. First, cards can be played in multiple ways. Players will constantly be challenged to make tradeoffs as they choose whether to use a card for some sort of advantage, keep it as a counter or use the card for its influence value to win a bid and move the player closer to winning the game. 
Next, Arkon employs a resource system based around silent auction bidding. Because all cards double as influence and winning bids is a key component of your victory condition, Arkon reduces the "dead card in hand" phenomenon.
   • Unique Resource System: In Arkon, to acquire clans to win the game, you need to bid for them with influence. What this creates is a dynamic where players on all turns are looking at what they want to bid for and what they are willing to give up in terms of actions.
• Pacing: After talking with our play testers, one of the most unique elements they highlighted was pacing. Most strategy card games are linear. You gather more resources, develop your engine and that creates momentum towards the victory. Arkon manages to have non-linear gameplay, while still making the win condition skill based through the multi-use cards. 
• Portable: With 52 cards and only one central deck, Arkon fits inside of a tuck box and can be played anywhere! 
 • Stunning Art: Although there is a lot of visually beautiful games out there, we think Arkon delivers an incredibly high level of art for a small-box game, and we are really proud of that. We have top end artists and designers that have worked on games from Magic the Gathering to Game of Thrones TCG. 
• Replay Value:  One of the core focuses while building and testing Arkon was replayability. We play tested the game extensively, with over 200 external blind tests taking place at local gaming stores and meet-ups across California. If you look at reviews on BoardGameGeek from those who have played, we were blown away by the positive feedback! 
 In Arkon players assume the role of a mysterious outsider who claims to be a fabled mystic from long ago. You enter the world of the Wildlands during a time of great unrest, where war and mistrust have sown deep divisions across the continent. As you wield your influence to amass support, you must choose….will you use that power to bring unity amongst the clans of the Wildlands... or will you seek domination....?
Read more on the lore...
                                             This tier is going to come with some pretty epic loot. First off, each backer will receive a custom etched wooden box with a deeply detailed engraving of the Wildlands world map on the lid. In addition, we will laser etch your name and backer # (or whatever phrase you prefer) on the inside.
Below are some shots from our early prototypes! These will continue to be refined as we play with modifications to the fine details to make this as crisp as possible in the final. THESE ARE NOT FINAL.
On top of that we will include a unique, brand new card in a speciality golden card border. This gold bordered card will ONLY be found at this tier (and is a Kickstarter Exclusive). The art will be done by Joshua Cairos, the artist responsible for many of our stunning compositions and a quickly rising star in the art world.

  My name is Casey. This kickstarter represents the culmination of 2 years of work on my gaming companies first product. Through ups and downs, managing of a 9 person team, and thousands of hours, we produced a tabletop game that I think is both beautiful and strategically deep. I was blessed to have the opportunity to work with my family and on something I believe in and for that I am immeasurably grateful.
This section is called, “Our Story” but really, I would love to tell you all about what I learned, why it matters and how that has shaped what we built.
First, when you are working tirelessly on a project that is your baby, your interminable obsession, understand and respect that your team is not always going to be as obsessed as you. This is okay. These are people that are helping turn your vision into reality, and without them I would of never had the beautiful art, videography, cartography and graphic design that is in the game today.
Choose something you care about. For me, gaming represents an amazing way to share a communal experience with people. In a game it doesn’t matter your age, your religion, your race, your politics, your gender, your orientation or your income. It’s about getting together over something common to all of us: a desire to have fun.
Surround yourself with good people. This is easily the most important thing. Entrepreneurship is just flat out hard.
Listen to your playtesters. We playtested this game all across California and for well over a year. Sometimes it was good, sometimes it was harsh (especially at the beginning). Each time we recorded specific feedback on sheets and looked for trends and thus things we could improve. The best feeling in the world was going to our last dozen playtests and realizing that all our iterations and balancing had paid off with a game that was more interactive and more strategic.
Learn that things will go wrong. Packages will get lost. The manufacturing will mis-cut prototypes. Your artists will ask for more money because you tell them to re-do something. Note that #1 this is inevitable and #2 when it comes to your team, take accountability. Your artist didn’t screw up, you screwed up by not giving a detailed and nuanced enough description of what you wanted. Learn and grow from it.
All of these lessons went into shaping what Arkon is. I know you all have a lot of choices when it comes to games. I deeply appreciate you taking the time to look at Arkon, and I hope you will consider our game as an edition to your collection.
 If you are an retailer, with a verifiable brick and mortar presence, please contact us at admin@arkongame.com for bulk pricing.

This is our first Kickstarter and as such, there is always the possibility of delays. That being said, we have some good things going for us. #1 the cards, packaging, art and all design work is 95%+ finished and we just will need to add promotional cards if we hit certain stretch goals.

We have an experienced packaging designer who has worked on high end projects, from Magic the Gathering to Pathfinder. That means less back and forth when we submit files for approval with the manufacturer. 

We are also using a well-known manufacturer in Panda, which is a reliable and consistent production house, so that means quicker turn-around and lower risk for malfunctions.

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
I wanted to spend some time doing a debrief after the fulfillment process. Today marks the 14th business day for international orders (they were supposed to deliver in 10-14 business days) and thus all packages should be arriving by end of day today. If you don't have your copy by the end of the day, don't panic, just touch base with me via a message (vs comment) and we will make sure you are taken care of!

Hey friends! 
I just wanted to let you know we are racing against the Christmas deadline and are doing our darndest to make it happen. 
The product is being split between three locations, inventory sent to Quartermaster Logistics (US/Canada), Gamesquest (All non-CA international) and my personal address (all designer tier fulfillment)
Inventory headed for Quartermaster is on its final leg, should arrive early this week.
Inventory headed for Gamesquest has arrived.

updates.update_userinfo: It's coming down to the wire!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
So things are progressing well! Our box designs for the designer tier backers were finalized and we are churning out some gorgeous looking boxes:

Hello friends!
It's official! Today we start the next leg of the race! We have delivered the signed and approved PPC checklist to our manufacturer (Panda) and now we wait ~10 weeks for them to manufacturer the game. We got a bit delayed with the modifications to the PPC but I'm glad we were able to clean up the rules a bit and fix a few aesthetic issues.
I will get an updated timeline to everyone ASAP but here is the general plan. Because of the delay in the PPC it looks like ocean shipping is now going to be to slow to make it by the holidays so I am now looking at air shipping the amount we need to fulfill the kickstarter (a week shipping vs. 4 weeks on ocean freight) and then sending the rest by boat. It'll hike the cost up a bit for me (okay, a lot), but I really, really want to get everyone their games by Christmas, so I am going to do everything in my power to make that happen.

Hey folks!
This is a quick update, we are a few weeks behind schedule for mass production starting but still are well on track to meet our Dec. deadline. Essentially, there ended up being three modifications we needed to make based on the PPC (Pre Production Copy)
1. Changing color contrast on a darker card

updates.update_userinfo: It's here!!!! Pre-production copy pictures and next steps
updates.update_content:
Hello crew,
It's funny being both a backer of kickstarters and now a founder of one. As a backer, games seem to all take a zillion years and you start to wonder why they take so bloody long. As a founder, every day is a new logistical challenge to attend to, some small tweak to make or some slight imperfection to fix. Time seems to shoot by at frightening speed.
Today, we finally received our pre-production copy. And there is some small fixes to be had and I will spend the next two weeks on that but... We did it. We have a finished game. It feels almost surreal. So many hours of work, ups and downs and here we are. It's a beaut!

updates.update_userinfo: Super quick update (and a better one to come shortly)
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
So I promised a once a month update and I was torn because the update I really want to show is the physical pre-production copy in hand! That will be coming shortly and we will have that update in the next few weeks. 
In short, files were good but we had to make some minor modifications to the rules sizing (standard and promo) to make stuff fit better so that just took a bit of extra time. The good news is as soon as we give the stamp of approval on the Pre-Production copy (that is set to be delivered shortly), we can move to Mass Production (which on the timeline is set to start Mid-August).

Hey crew!
Realized in all the hustle and bustle this week I didn't get an update out to everyone! We officially have all the files out and are on to our next steps. We are happy with all the extra testing we were able to get in to balance on the Role cards (still not a year plus of testing like we had for the base version, but we did our darndest!). 
The deck will be separated as follows inside the tuckbox: Standard rules next to base game, next to promo rules, next to promo cards.

This last month has been crazy busy! Continuing to play-test like mad and getting all our art finalized. Desert Child is a Racing RPG set in a dusty world where your only friends are a vintage hoverbike and a bowl of ramen noodles.
It's the rags-to-riches story of a broke young racer who fights through gangsters, bounty hunters and pancake cravings to enter the Championship and get off Earth before it E-X-P-L-O-D-E-S (metaphorically).  
The player begins their story on a ruined Earth, with just a few days to get to Mars. From there, you'll win races, customize your bike, and earn fans, but at the same time, you'll have to work jobs, eat dinner, and pay rent. 
Nothing's free, but everything has it's price.
Hunt bounties, deliver drugs, throw races - do anything you can to earn cash. 
Explore a pixel-art solar system inspired by Cowboy Bebop, Akira and Redline.

Customize your beloved bike with Guns, Amplifiers and tasteless bumper stickers.

Dine on a range of interplanetary cuisine with sweet buffs to help you win.

Master deep combat and racing mechanics and define your own style.

Race, shoot, and get better! Designed for replayability, with a buttload of secrets to keep you coming back.

Chill to a sci-fi soundtrack.
The game is locked-in for a Steam (Windows, Mac, Linux) release, with the possibility of a Nintendo Switch and Playstation 4 release in the future.
  Racing - The bread and butter of the game, racing is what you live for. It's your ticket off Earth and the key to a better life. You'll start small, hustling on the underground circuit, but always with an eye on the Solar Championship Cup.
Side jobs - Sometimes, racing just won't be enough. Sometimes, you'll have to lie, cheat, and steal. Sometimes you'll have a pound of horse in the trunk when you get searched at the boarder. When that happens, you'll have to decide what kind of man you are.
Explore the City - The hub cities of Mullahoe, New Olympia and Europa Uno are all havens for someone like you. Bursting with colour and culture, you'll never be short of something (or someone) to keep you busy. If you want to make it big, you'd better learn their streets like the back of your hand. 
Wheelin' & Dealin' - Nothing's free in Desert Child, but everything has it's price. Upgrade and customize your hoverbike by sourcing rare and exotic Amplifiers from shops and characters around the city. You might have to get your hands dirty, call in favors, or even throw a race or two, but I'm sure it'll all be worth it.
Customization - Need dat speed? How about bullets so big they fill half the screen with fiery death? Oh, I see, you're more into stripping back your bike to lessen your drag! Tweak your setup with Amps and Units 'till your hearts content in the ONLY game that lets you build your own vintage hoverbike.
Tunes - As you progress through the story, new music will become unlocked at the in-game record store, Ding Ding's. You can customise your own soundtrack with this music. Not into Choc Bomb's beats? That's cool, just fill your playlist with Ice Cream Sandwich tracks.

    Hey, wow, this is happening! I'm Oscar, the creator of Desert Child. I like long walks on the beach and sharing banana milkshakes. 
For the last year, I've been working on Desert Child alongside studying my Masters of Architecture. I've done all the graphics, programming, and the music. I've never felt more married to a game before; commited to every aspect being perfect.
Desert Child was inspired by my favourite anime, Cowboy Bebop, Akira and Redline. I've never really seen a game that tries to capture the unique elements of these three. The world of Cowboy Bebop, the insane depiction of speed from Redline, and the... teen cool of Akira.

There's a tonne of games that influenced Desert Child, but I guess if I had to make a short list, I would say: Flashback, Driver, Vanquish, Luftrausers, FFVIII and Nier: Automata. (This list was really hard to make that short)

Other things that really inspire me are the architecture of Shin Takamatsu, Italian futurism and 36 Chambers.
So making games is actually kinda pricey! Who knew? When I spent my meager savings showing Desert Child at Indiecade @ E3, I honestly wasn't expecting it to get the reception it did. The reaction from the community made me realise this game is something that needs to be developed into a larger experience.

Desert Child needs time and talent to become the game I know it can be, and the support of the community will help it grow into something special. The initial funding goal will help to afford tools, music, licensing, and production costs. Further stretch goals will let us create the truly perfect, awesome, ideal, crunchy version of the game.
Indiecade @ E3
    Wallpaper Pack
This is a pack of 3 desktop wallpapers exclusive to kickstarter backers. 1920x1080 and made with love.
Name in credits
Your full name (or whatever you call yourself) will appear in the game's credits. I do reserve the right to decline anything I find offensive or inappropriate, but I'm pretty filthy, so it's unlikely. 
DesertChild.exe (The Game)
The standard game will be sent out on release day. Planned platforms are Windows, Linux and Mac OSX. You will get both a DRM-free version and a Steam key. Everyone backing at $10 or more will get this.
  Kickstarter Hoverbike Decal
A Kickstarter-exclusive alternative hoverbike to play throught the story with. Let the world know you liked the game before it was cool.
Beta Access
You will be invited to play and break the private beta of Desert Child. This will be in February 2018. The beta will remain playable until release of the full game.
Soundtrack (Digital)
The game's soundtrack will be sent out around the time of the game's release.
Instruction Booklet + Boxart (Digital)
A digital version of the game's instruction manual. Features character bios, stories, secrets and hidden strategies. Also includes boxart that can be printed and assembled, or just admired on a wall.
Prototypes + My developer notebooks
You will get copies of every early prototype that went into Desert Child, even the insanely hard version where your boost was a limited resource. You also get PDF copies of all my notebooks and sketches, where you can see all the different ideas that made it into the game, and all the brain farts that didn't.
Get to name a Racer
You get to have your name/gamer tag/dog's name used as a name for one of the randomly generated opponents in the game. Your name/gamer tag/dog's name will show up at the start of any race that opponent is in, and may even show up in the Championship Ladder towards the end of the game.
Quick disclaimer: Don't be too rude or I'll have to say 'sorry, I'm not doing that.' 
Personalised Hoverbike Decal
I will design a unique, personalised hoverbike decal for your use in the game. You'll get a special access key to activate it, which you can either keep to yourself, or share with the world. You will become a minor celebrity, and people will like you more.
Physical Instruction Booklet + Boxart
A physical copy of the game's instruction manual. Features character bios, stories, secrets and hidden strategies. Also includes boxart that can be placed in a vacuum-sealed case and resold on ebay in 50 years to pay your mortgage.
Desert Child Stickers
Rad stickers with art and characters from the game. These aren't just logos and things, these are stickers that you would actually have in the Desert Child universe. You're a fan of Pablo's Beer? There's a Pablo's sticker. Boom.
Hoverbike License + Arrest Warrant (Physical)
Your very own, personalised Hoverbike License and Arrest Warrant. They'll both have your name and picture on them (either a photograph, or I can draw your portrait). You can even request what you're wanted for, or I can come up with some insane crime you were responsible for.
Postcard from your great Aunt Thelma (Physical)
A postcard with some cool, limited art on it. It will also have a nice, personalised message from your Great Aunt Thelma, who lives on a Rock Wallaby Ranch on Ganymede and has terrible hemorrhoids. Alternately, I could leave the postcard blank so you can use it yourself. Also, I might put on lipstick and kiss the card.
 Junior Co-Vice President Wingman of Design Execution & Logistics
You and I will Skype 3 times over the course of development and I'll run ideas by you, play you some new music, and let you in on story secrets. I'll take onboard your thoughts, explain my design process, and hopefully we can make the game even better. You'll be my wingman! Also, you'll be credited in the game's credits as "Junior Co-Vice President Wingman of Design Execution & Logistics" somewhere near the top.
Personal game jam with me
If you've ever wanted to make a game, this is the reward tier for you. A game jam is when people come together for 48 hours and make a game from scratch. I have TONNES of experience doing game jams, so if it sounds scary, don't worry, I've got your back. YOU DON'T NEED TO HAVE EXPERIENCE MAKING GAMES TO DO A GAME JAM!

So, what kind of game do you want to make? Game jams are pretty short, but intensely creative. We won't be able to make the next Skyrim or GTA V in 48 hours, but we can definitely make a start. Some games that were originally game jams are SUPERHOT, Goat Simulator, Titan Souls, Gods Will Be Watching, Surgeon Simulator, Super Time Force Ultra, and Snake Pass.

These all had additional development, but their core idea and mechanics were created during a game jam. If you want to see some cool examples of game jam games, check these out: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/39/results Once we finish the game jam, the finished game is entirely yours to do whatever you want with. You might decide to polish it up and release it, or maybe you just want to put it up on Gamejolt or itch.io for people to play for free. It's up to you.

Quick disclaimer: I'm not uptight. I like being offensive as much as the next person. However, if the game you want to make is racist, sexist, homophobic, or vilifies any person or group, I'll have to say 'sorry, I'm not making that.' Game jams are meant to be fun! Not negative :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As of October 2017, the game has been in development for 16 months, with no major obstacles to it's release. Desert Child has been a labor of love for me, and insane amount of planning and pre-production that has gone into it makes me certain that the game will be completed and be everything I'm setting out to make it. 

I have 11 years of experience working with the tools I'm using, and have worked on a commercial game from beginning until release.With the exception of some massive, unthinkable tragedy occuring to me, I am absolutley commited to finishing this game and getting it into your hands.

updates.update_content:
Hey everybody!
So I just finished sending out the last of the backer rewards. 
If you think I've screwed up something, please send me a message, not a comment, and I can get onto it straight away.
I hope everyone likes the wallpapers! I'm actually pretty stoked on them and am holding back with all my might from tweeting them out to the world, haha. So yeah, please enjoy their kickstarter exclusivity.

Hey guys, just a quick update to apologise about the silence/delay. 
If you don't know, Australia elected several children in a row to be prime minister, and they kinda broke our internet.
I had to get my connection moved over to the national broadband network and didn't have any internet for two weeks, but its back up now, and I'll be able to work fully on kickstarter again. Yay!
Oh, also, don't vote for the LNP at the next election, or I'll update Desert Child to be 100gb, just to punish Australian players.

Hey everyone, I hope you all had a great christmas/holiday/third thing. I took a couple of weeks off for my girlfriend's birthday, and went to Thailand to let some of my hair grow back, but I'm back now and working on everyone's backer rewards, which I hope to have done in February. Sorry about the delay, it's just that December is kind of a crazy month, even when you're not launching a videogame. 
In other news, Desert Child has had a couple of patches to fix bugs and a few performance drops, and the game's in a pretty good place right now. I'm thinking about doing one more content update to add some little extras for you guys, but that will probably be a couple of months off.

Hey guys!

Just quickly wanted to ask, if you want to, please drop a review on Steam :) 

It really helps get the game infront of more people.

Oh and if you do, don't check the little box saying you got the game for free. You paid by pledging through Kickstarter. (Unless you did somehow get it for free)

Hey everyone,
Just a quick update to let you know that backer keys have been sent.
If you haven't received and email, please check your spam folder.

If there's still nothing, then send me a message and I'll sort it out.

Thanks again for all your support, and I hope you're all enjoying the game!

Cheers,

Okay guys, we did it.

Desert Child is done, dusted, and about to release in about half an hour.

This has been a crazy experience for me; definitely the biggest achievement of my life so far, and I owe it all to your support. Without you guys, Desert Child may never have happened, so give your self a big pat on the back. We did it!

There might be a delay of codes for backers, and this is my fault. I'm using itch.io's steam code mass email service to send you all codes, but I didn't realise they needed to review the email before it can be sent. As of right now, they're still reviewing it, but I shouldn't think it will take too long. I'm really sorry about this delay, but please know I'm doing everything to get you your codes as soon as possible.

though, so if you see that update, and haven't gotten an email, then please get in contact with me and I'll sort it out. Also...

campaign.story:
PS4/Xbox Ports [REACHED!]
As it suggests, we'll be able to port Flynn to Xbox One and PS4! Funds will go to the necessary development tools and time needed.
Challenge Mode [REACHED!]
We'll have some extra resources to put towards a unique challenge mode! Put your Flynn skills to the test in the arena with survival and boss rush trials!
Animated Intro
We'll be able to work with our pals over at Studio Yotta to create an animated intro for Flynn: Son of Crimson! It'll be pretty and juicy and whoa!
Rozia Story DLC
An alternate character in a DLC story played alongside Flynn's journey! We already have this story planned out, these funds would help it become a reality! All backers receiving the game will get the DLC at no charge.
  Flynn: Son of Crimson is a 2D action adventure platformer with metroidvania elements. Set in a wondrous world with a looming darkness beginning to awaken yet again.
What can you expect?
Explore a wondrous world filled with discovery, taking place in unique regions designed with non-linear exploration.
Swap between multiple weapons with quick and satisfying combat.
Dive in to a land with ancient mysteries and rich story.
Travel across the lands, discovering new ways to roam and opening new paths using the power of crimson.
Dip in and out of an alternate dimension to make unique alterations to the real world.
View a realm full of life, carefully formed with hand-crafted pixel art.
Trade trinkets for new combat techniques and runes with an old war veteran.
Call on your companion Dex in times of need, a mystical and loyal creature.
Test your strength in the feared Rustwood coliseum among other challenging feats.
Take on the role of Flynn, a young man orphaned as a child who sets out to chase the shadows of his beginnings whilst awakening the ancient power of Crimson within him. 
Discover relics of ancient Rosantica, effigies and monuments to the goddess Sorrell that reveal hints at Flynn’s beginnings and unlock new powers. Reveal secret pathways, trade with villagers, battle fierce monsters, hang out with dogs.
    What about the Switch?
We've received a lot of requests for the Switch, we hear you! We'd love to launch on as many platforms as possible, but there is a problem. Flynn is being created in Gamemaker Studio 2, which is a great engine, but it currently does not support porting to the Switch. If we were to go for it now, Flynn would have to be recreated in an entirely new engine, which as you can imagine is a lot of work. Just know that Yoyo games is working hard on trying to make a Switch port possible! We can set up a later stretch goal for a Switch port, but until then we'll have to hope for the port to become available during Flynn's development! We'll keep everyone updated as Yoyo games and Nintendo work it out.
  From the very first stages of development, we began designing Flynn: Son of Crimson with fast paced, satisfying combat. We’re strong believers that ‘game feel’ should be priority in any video game so we've been injecting as much juice as we can to make sure every hit packs a punch and feels extra tasty.
Trade gems and trinkets acquired throughout the game to learn new techniques for Flynn’s arsenal, and you’ll soon find that you can figure out your own favourite combination of attacks (Smash, bash, tickle, tickle, bosh!). Designed with quick and easy weapon swapping in mind, you’re never more than a button press away from your desired weapon so you better dispatch your foes with flair, else you’re not the cool hero everyone thought! 
The Crimson Blade, a staple in Flynn's arsenal (and the default starting weapon, but that doesn’t sound as appealing!) is the first weapon of Crimson energy gifted to Flynn by the Goddess Sorrell in a great time of need. Unlocking and mastering the uppercut will provide some serious hang time to any foe that is on the receiving end. Or why not slice through many baddies with the piercing dash? Piece of cake.
The Crimson Axe demands precise timing and enemy prediction, trading the quick cuts of the crimson blade for a weighty windup, this axe packs a punch sure to leave your enemies as a smear on the floor. Use the axe to crush your enemy's shields, and smash brittle walls to access new areas with brute force. It’s a wonder how the young one can lift this, but as we wrote this we realized it is made of energy, whoops.
The Crimson Claws, a swift and energetic set of weapons used to stagger enemies with high attack speed and air superiority, if that’s your sort of thing. Unleash your inner wildcat with unique wall climbing (go home, Knuckles) and a spiral drill attack (you too, Taz) to tear into enemies and dig through soft ground, these high mobility weapons will have you on your toes and keep your hands warm.
What would our youthful hero be without a ranged weapon? That's right, a hero without a ranged weapon. So here's a bow, not any old bow, but a Super Awesome Crimson Bow™ (nice). Acquired early on in the game, this will help you hurt/take out weaker foes from a distance. Use the bow to trigger traps and puzzles, and even augment with elemental arrows such as ice, electricity, and explosive (explosions are an element, right?). Once you've unlocked them, it's your choice which to roll out with, depending on your play style, whoa!
Set in the world of Rosantica after the Great Conflict, a war that carried on for decades between parallel worlds, one of humanity, one of gods. The worlds once kept in peace by the Crimson Goddess Sorrell and Lord Zealock, now torn between each other.
The Great Conflict between overlapping worlds, caused by Sorrell’s forbidden love of a mortal knight, Allistair. Falling for humanity's innocence and good nature, Sorrell leaves her world for another, sending Zealock into madness with her involvement with the "frail humanity".
Decades of war have gone by between worlds, as things begin to look grim for the people of Rosantica. Realizing she can do no more to protect them from Zealock's growing rage, Sorrell initiates an ultimate sacrifice with her and her love, giving their lives to banish what has now become The Scourge. Locking Lord Zealock and his followers away to the malicious world they have created.
But don’t live in the past, the world around you is brimming with exploration and discovery. Track down a mysterious stranger that appears to be following you as the barrier between worlds begins to crack, and investigate her ties to The Scourge and Zealock.
  Roam the fantastic world both on foot and with your loyal companion Dex, a last gift from Sorrell and a guardian of Rosantica, helping both man and beast alike take back their homes. Will you follow Flynn on his journey through this war torn land?
  Venture into the heart of evil itself, and tackle the horrors of The Scourge head-on. A once pristine land of gods, now an infested land filled with hatred. Track clues about your past and the Crimson power that grows within you leading to this nest of evil, and uncover what really lies at the heart.
Flynn must hurry, with every passing day The Scourge’s hold on Rosantica grows, slowly plunging the world into madness and decay with its noxious corruption. You must seek to end Zealock’s reign of disease and lunacy before it’s too late. 
Traveling between dimensions, Flynn controls the ability to tear open portals to The Scourge with the power of Crimson. Finding alternate paths and searching for trapped Rosanticans taken away from their homes. But be wary, The Scourge has many eyes in search of Flynn.
    Journey through the vast island of Rosantica in search for answers to stop the land from falling victim to the corruption. The world is pieced together to transition seamlessly as you travel across the 5 unique regions.
Explore the frigid Mistral Peak – a frozen over mountain once brimming with enterprise and discovery of its rich natural resources and fossils, now fallen victim to The Scourge’s wretched influence in the form of a supernaturally dangerous blizzard. Discover what infernal power has summoned up this ferocious storm and help put a stop to it.
Wade through the once secluded and dazzling waters of The Hollow's Isles. A group of seaside caverns and alcoves that were once the pinnacle of natural beauty and serenity that have been ravaged by the relentless winds brought on by the blizzards of Mistral Peak above. Track your quest into the damp caves to battle off the mutated crustaceans that have forced out the indigenous Neptyn to flee their ancestral homes.
Lose yourself in the sprawling gardens of Rustwood. Home to the legendary proving grounds of the warrior tribe, the Mazir, and their Fighting Coliseum. The Mazir are a beetle-like people that are honor bound to prove themselves capable warriors by duking it out in this immense arena. Be warned, however, for The Scourge has seeped even into this land of once sacred trials. The swamps of Rustwood grow darker as each day goes by, causing hazardous poison storms to awaken.
Your quest for knowledge will eventually lead you to the home of all scholarly pursuits, the famed Shivering Spire. What used to be the beacon of knowledge and symbol of Rosantica’s prosperity, is now home to a portal of the netherworld, with its devout healers and once benevolent sorcerers now becoming vessels for The Scourge’s evil magic to pour into the world of Rosantica. Flynn will be bombarded with acolytes that are now driven mad by their enhanced dark powers, as well as assaulted by powerful warlocks that once dared to challenge gods themselves.
In between journeys, Flynn will return to Sanctia. A stronghold where his most valued allies reside, banding together to help Flynn fight off the corruption. Here Flynn will barter rare Crimson Shards found throughout the world for new techniques and upgrades, as well as complete quests for the villagers.
Flynn: Son of Crimson features crisp, hand-crafted pixel art that's designed to compliment its frenetic gameplay. Readability and strong visual tells are key components in our artistic process, as we realize how important it is for a game to be crystal-clear in its visual feedback to the player.  
Each chunky pixel is deliberately and thoughtfully placed to create a memorable world for players to explore. Mischievous goblins, big-bellied fish men, blood-thirsty wolves, and more are brought to life with expressive animations brimming with personality.
From concept art, to character sprites, and final polished animations - we aim to deliver a product we're truly proud of, and one that communicates to our players how much we truly care for the timeless and endearing craft of pixel-art!
    From our composer, Jacob Lincke: Starting with a clean slate is always exciting and inspiring. “Flynn: Son of Crimson” needs satisfying music to accompany its already magical looking art style. I started looking at things I thought the game reminded me of; other games, movies and even places in the real world. I want the soundtrack to have its own unique voice, instantly connecting it to the game.
I have a deep love for traditional folk music from all over the world which made me think of all sorts of fun instruments and what they could bring to the table. Flutes and keyed fiddles are combined with medieval lutes and finally mixed together with a grand orchestra making you feel less alone. All of this and a touch of retro synths to go along with the cute art style results in a collaboration between Scandinavian folk music and the Far East.
I imagined Flynn wandering enchanting forests such as those found in Ghibli movies and traversing cold mountains of my homeland Sweden. I want the music to help Flynn telling his story, setting the atmosphere and be beautiful at the same time.
    Always felt like you needed something Crimsony for your wall? Me too. Put this pretty 18" by 24" poster all over it and have your friends say, "whoa"! A beautiful illustration by Jaya Ply (@Nikingply).
Get warm with this high quality t-shirt designed by miski! Printed on a 50/50 blend shirt for maximum comfort. We may or may not kiss each one before they ship. T-shirt sizing and possible color options will be provided after the campaign.
Dig your eyes intothe Official Flynn: Son of Crimson art book containing used and unused concept art, pixel art, level design sketches, fan art, a deeper look into the lore, and more! Size of the book to be decided later in development, based on our content. 
Become one with the game with your spooky skeleton in the ground, and your likeness drawn in to your own gravestone to be placed in the Rustwood Graveyard. In other words, your face on a rock. 
Design an NPC to fit in to the game! We'll contact you to work on your NPC's design, personality, dialogue (nothing naughty!), back story, and favorite things.
Get your own custom room! You choose its location, style, what it's full of, maybe a bit of lore, maybe a bit of graffiti, maybe your face everywhere, I don't know. Put your own flair in to it!
Combine every design tier before to create a sidequest! Include your secret room and your NPC in this quest to make Flynn fetch a bucket of water, or to do 50 pushups, whatever your heart desires!
A story being told right from our hearts and fingers, Flynn is a young baby boy that has been on our minds over the last two years. As we write this, we are roughly one full year into development on Flynn: Son of Crimson from when we began putting this design all on paper.
actual paper!
So far being funded completely by our own money, we feel we're now in a good place to introduce Flynn to Kickstarter. In order to continue to fulfill our dreams in making Flynn a real boy, we need your support! We're very confident in the head start we have on the basics in design and development, with a lot of the core features already built and working. A large portion will be going to the art, allowing us to give our artists more consistent hours and maybe even hire extra help. Additionally, the sound is very important to us, so that will be a big investment as well.
Is this your first game? 
First bigger scale game, yes. We have 2 other games we released in the wild on mobile though, which can be found here:  
Samurai Blitz
Raccoon Rascals
We also have a couple projects we have worked on in the past that didn’t quite make the cut (we all have them), but we see them as more of a learning process and who knows, we may come back to them in 50 years time.
Special Thanks
Andrew Filip - Web design/development, help with the trailer.
Johan Aronson - Being part of Flynn's original birth long ago, and the title screen.
miski - Being the greatest for designing the t-shirt last minute with us.

updates.update_content:
Hello Flynn friends, been a while! As we near the end of development, these updates get a little more difficult, so we're sorry for the delay. As always, if we're quiet, we're just working hard :) Now have some news on the release!
Beta Backers
No we haven't forgotten about you Beta backers! As a quick update on the Beta, we're going to officially be reaching the Beta stage veeery soon, so we will keep everyone updated on the delivery of the test build! For anyone worried about game spoilers, the beta test build is going to be a custom area and mostly combat focused, not a portion of the story. So the only spoilers will be how cool our boy Flynn is ;)
Release news

Hey Crimson babies, we just wanted to send out a quick on update on how progress has been during the current world situation, and give you some Flynn gameplay to look at!
We've done our best to keep development going at a steady rate, and Flynn is as healthy as ever! Each member of the team has had their own experience with quarantine, as we are based in several states in the US, as well as England and Sweden. We're lucky to work remotely, so we can continue the same way, but we're doing our best to take care of our personal mental health through this difficult time. We hope all of you are doing well through this tough time!

Hey Flynn fans, we hope you've all had a good start to 2020 so far! It has been a little while since our last update, and we do apologize for the silence. We're still working full time and putting everything we can in to the game, so rest assured our silence doesn't mean any delays are happening in development! Sometimes we just have to keep game secrets for the final release ya know, but here are a bunch of GIFs to look at as usual!
Hello Crimson children! While we are working hard on that 2020 release date, here are some juicy GIFs for you all showing off some gameplay with your favorite puppy companion, Dex!

Hey all Flynn fans, we have big news we can finally reveal today!
We're very happy to announce that we've partnered with Humble as Flynn's publisher! We've been working together for quite a while now, with them helping take a large load off of our shoulders so we can whip Flynn into shape and focus on making the best game possible for all of you!

Hello friends, your favorite horses back with another Flynn update. What better way to start than with some GIFs!
Puzzley bits
We've been having some fun with small puzzles recently, creating a nice balance between platforming/puzzles and combat. Flynn does more than just slice clublins all day!

campaign.story:
Missed the campaign? Hat is Available Now on Discord!
discord.gg/kingofthehat
*Discord is a chat app for games. Talk to other players, give suggestions, and help shape the Hat. We're almost always online - so come and say hi!
PLAY

King of the Hat is a fast-paced, hat based, multiplayer game. In this cutesy dystopian world everyone is born with a hat that hosts their soul, and can only die if their hat gets crushed. Your hat can be used as a weapon BUT BE CAREFUL because its also your weakness. Jump around, whip your hat at your friends, crush theirs, and become the King of the Hat!
Genre: Couch Multiplayer / Platformer / Fighting
Number of players: 2 - 4 players
Platforms: Steam (PC & Mac)
Early Access Release: 2017 
King of the Hat is a local-multiplayer game, where instead of jumping on people's heads you have to jump on their hats. The thing is, you can throw your hat!
You can throw your hat to ...
Avoid enemies who are about to jump on your head
Knock another player away and knock his hat towards you
Leave it as bait for your opponent
Distract your opponents while you go and crush their hat
Block an incoming hat throw
All these options lead to lots of different styles of matches!
Once upon a time in a far away land, there was a beautiful castle in a place called Hatlandia. Here, you were born with a sacred Hat, and if it ever got killed, the wearer would die. In Hatlandia, the Hatfolk lived peacefully. Occasionally a donkey would step on someones hat, twisting them out of existence forever. For the most part though, it was a pretty idyllic life …
However, Hatlandia was located right next to an even older city called Business Corp. And when the Fatcats over in Business Corp. heard about these Hatlandian festivities, they decided to check them out.
They showed up stinking of milk and catnip, and had such a time at the Hat Parade that they came back and killed the King. They captured the kingdom, bulldozed the Hatlandian Hills, and paved some parking lots.
The whole thing was actually in really bad taste, in this narrators humble opinion.
Now, they’ve built an arena and broadcast a show called King of the Hat, where the remaining Hatlandians have to fight each other for the entertainment of a live studio audience.
We're in the process of writing the OST, and designing the sound effects. We've picked a jazz big-band mood for the level music, and we're thinking about punchy-sounding-hit effects for hat collisions. Have a listen!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're confident that King of the Hat will be delivered to our backers in a timely manner with all promises honoured. The demo on this page reflects seven months of hard work, and it's only going to get better from here! 

King of the Hat was our final semester student project, and it's by far the biggest game we've made to date. It is still that though, a project made by students. So while we don't have a huge amount of industry experience, we do have another game shipped and a bunch of mentors to help us along the way.

Our last game, Zohm: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.hyroglyphik.zohmofficial&hl=en

If you've made it this far we want to extend a huuuuge thank you. Your support means a great deal to us and we're excited to go on this journey with you.

Are you the type of Dungeons & Dragons player that just wants to sleep with everything? 
Hi, I'm game designer Jason Anarchy. I make the Drinking Quest series and this is my new game!
Chuglox, Daiquirin, Bartlebut and Annoying Sidekick ARE BACK! And this time they are REALLY OUT OF SHAPE FROM ALL THE DRINKING! Except for Annoying Sidekick who is now in great shape because he's really annoying.
Drinking Quest is a really simple, quick-start RPG but when your hero dies... you chug your drink in real life to continue!
The last Kickstarter (For Journey into Draught) Added two extra quests, a coin token, a cloth map and other extras... and we're starting with that standard this time without even having to unlock them as stretch goals!
If you've never played Drinking Quest before, this is a great starting point. If you have played Drinking Quest before, then you know to expect a fun new adventure!
Please quest responsibly.
Jason
 Quest 1: Rekt On Rum 
The heroes sail toward their destination, or farther from it, they're just really bad at this.
Quest 2: Hangover Bay 
After crashing their ship, the heroes accidently wash up in Hangover Bay! By incredible coincidence, this is where they wanted to end up anyway.
Quest 3: Sticky Thicket 
The heroes take a break on their adventure to try and keep bees and harvest some delicious honey.
Quest 4: Fizz Fang's Freezer 
An ice dungeon and the home of a dragon who likes his drinks cold. Beware the mighty FIZZ FANG!
Bonus Quest: Fairy Rehab (not a stretch goal, this is in the final game) 
There is a “Sober Up” quest in the game run by the fairies of Hop Garden.
Bonus Quest: Bar Trek (not a stretch goal, this is in the final game)  
This is a parody of that Star Wars show everyone likes.
Imagine this framed over a fireplace
Here are the four main hero cards with their coresponding "Signature Drink" cards.
Jason Anarchy - Designer, Writer, Huge Biceps 
Michael Parla - Cover artist and development artist, Michael did the artwork for a game called MoonQuake Escape which I thought looked amazing and I really wanted to work with him.
Zach Shuster - Quest 1 and Hero Cards, I met this guy while drinking after a con in Edmonton. I had no idea he could draw such stylish Sword & Sorcery!
Zach draws "Sexy Cthulhu"
Shawna Saycocie - Quest 2 and Shop Card, Shawna draws beautiful cartoony stuff but can also make it really funny.
Shawna drew this warm and inviting shop card!
Ben Tobitt - Quest 3, Ben did the "Crappy Wizards" quest in the last game and I wanted him back for more! Also he's the only British artist in this list and they scientifically drink more than anyone in the world.
The Bee Holder
Ben Granoff - Quest 4, This Ben is also back from the last game. He does closer to standard Sword & Sorcery styles but it has this wonderful frantic quality about it. He drew the "Need for Mead" quest in the last game.
Ben G. got all the fun cards, like throwing your back out while shoveling snow
Deanna Laver -  Bar Trek Bonus Quest, I've worked with Deanna a bunch of times and she can draw in a lot of different styles. She drew the original "Kega Man" quest in Trilogy Edition and the "Walkenguaard" Lord of the Rings parody in Journey into Draught.
"Man in Lizard Costume"
Dara Gold - Hop Garden Fairy Rehab Bonus Quest, Dara drew the tea stained "Sober Up Quest" in the last game but this time she's drawing in a total different style with no tea at all! So Dara always gets to draw the Sober Up Quests and I have no idea if she likes to drink in real life.
Rachel Kahn - Alternate Cover & Map, If you backed "Pretending to Grownup" you may remember a card called CRUSH-YOUR-ENEMIES UNIPEGASAURUS. It was a really great card and I wanted to work with Rachel again. Sword & Sorcery is her jam!
Ship Naked: They're the biggest, most trusted name in Kickstarter fulfillment and I want to make sure shipping is the smoothest it can possibly be. (And no extra duty costs for international backers!)
Ad Magic - They will be manufacturing the game. They printed the last Drinking Quest game and have also printed some struggling indie games like Joking Hazard and Cards Against Humanity.
You, the backers! - Thank you for making this possible and I hope you have some legendary game nights!
